marketNews.title: ADRO: Analysis of AADI Spin-off Scenarios
marketNews.content: Approaching Adaro Energy Indonesia's (ADRO) EGM on November 18, 2024, and the pre-emptive rights offering (PUPS) of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) in December 2024, we attempt to analyze the optimal option for ADRO investors regarding the AADI spin-off corporate action. There are 2 options for ADRO investors, namely: Participating in the AADI PUPS. This option is further broken down into 3 scenarios, namely: Base-case scenario: implying 5x PE for AADI and 6.6x PE for ADRO. Bull-case scenario: implying 5x PE for AADI and 8.9x PE for ADRO. Bear-case scenario: implying 5x PE for AADI and 3.8x PE for ADRO. Not participating in the AADI PUPS. Option 1: Participating in the AADI PUPS Based on our calculations, ADRO investors who use their dividends to participate in the AADI PUPS are potentially more advantaged because: The price of ADRO shares is highly likely to fall after the AADI spin-off and dividend distribution due to reduced net profit potential post-spin-off. If the price of ADRO shares does not decrease after the spin-off, ADRO has the potential to trade at a valuation of 13.3x PE. The price of AADI shares has the potential for a re-rating to the 5x PE level, which we consider a more reasonable and conservative level. This 5x PE level is still below ADRO's 5-year historical mean of 6.9x PE, as well as the valuation of other coal issuers such as PTBA (7.7x PE FY24F annualized) and ITMG (6.87x PE FY24F annualized). In the long term, ADRO's valuation will be influenced by market sentiment and net profits from the development of the aluminum smelter and hydroelectric power plant (PLTA) projects, which are expected to commence operations in 2025 and 2030, respectively. Option 2: Not Participating in the AADI IPO Meanwhile, we see that investors who only take the dividend and do not participate in the AADI PUPS potentially receive lower returns or even risk suffering losses compared to investors who participate in the AADI PUPS. This is because investors who do not participate in the AADI PUPS will face a potential decline in ADRO share prices without gaining the potential upside from the increase in AADI share prices. The AADI PUPS redemption rights cannot be sold either. Investors who choose this option potentially lose the ADRO thermal coal business at a valuation of 2.7x PE 1H24 annualized, lower than the 5-year historical mean of ADRO and its peers. Notes: Assumptions We Used Some basic assumptions we used in our calculations are: The purchase price for ADRO uses the closing price on Tuesday (12/11) at Rp3,820/share. The dividend paid by ADRO reaches the maximum level, which is Rp1,352/share. Dividend payment is implemented concurrently with the PUPS execution. The AADI PUPS price equals the upper limit of the IPO price range at Rp5,900/share, which is also the maximum limit of the PUPS price range. The subscription ratio is 100:23 (every 100 ADRO shares owned will receive the right to subscribe to 23 AADI shares in the PUPS). The Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar is 15,811. This article was released in Stockbit Commentary, where investors can view more complete assumptions/data here: https://stockbit.com/post/16333888. Key Takeaway From the scenarios above, we see that investors potentially book a larger profit if they exercise their right to exercise the AADI PUPS compared to just taking dividends and not exercising the AADI PUPS. Using the worst-case scenario in the bear-case scenario, where ADRO shares are valued using only 50% cash + 50% holding discount for ADMR (equivalent to 3.8x PE), investors potentially book only a loss of -5.7%. This figure is still smaller compared to the potential loss if investors do not execute the AADI PUPS, which is around -14.9%.

tickerNews.title: ITMG 9M24: Net Profit -32.7% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah (ITMG) reported a net profit of US$144 million (+113.3% QoQ, +45.6% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a net profit for 9M24 of US$273 million (-32.7% YoY). ITMG's net profit for 9M24 exceeded expectations as it stood at 76%/83% of the FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. Operationally, revenue grew +8.5% QoQ and cost of goods sold decreased -0.3% QoQ, causing the gross profit margin to increase to 33.6% (vs. 2Q24: 27.8%). Furthermore, operating expenses only rose +6.6% QoQ, lower than the gross profit growth, which drove operating profit growth higher to +43.1% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: INCO Announces $9 Billion Investment for Nickel Production Increase
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia (INCO) announced a target to increase nickel production fourfold in the next decade to meet global demand for critical minerals essential for electric energy structure supply and other clean technology. To meet this demand, INCO and its partners are injecting an investment of US$9 billion.

tickerNews.title: BEI Changes Stock Code for GoTo's Multiple Voting Rights Shares to GOTOM
tickerNews.content: The IDX announced a change in the stock code for GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) shares with multiple voting rights to GOTOM. This code change is in connection with the IDX Board of Directors Decree Number Kep-00172/BEI/10-2024 dated October 29, 2024, concerning implementation provisions related to the listing and trading of shares with multiple voting rights. The GOTO ordinary shares are still listed under the GOTO code.

tickerNews.title: SPTO to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp35 per Share
tickerNews.content: Surya Pertiwi (SPTO) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 94.5 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 21, 2024, with payment on December 10, 2024. Referring to the SPTO share price at the Wednesday (13/11) closing, the indicative dividend yield is 5.3%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp12 per Share
tickerNews.content: Surya Toto Indonesia (TOTO) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 123.8 billion rupiah or 12 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 21, 2024, with payment on December 12, 2024. Referring to the TOTO share price at the Wednesday (13/11) closing at 238 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 5%.

tickerNews.title: SGER Signs Coal Purchase Agreement Potentially Worth Rp3 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Sumber Global Energy (SGER) signed a coal purchase agreement of 2 million tons with PT Merge Mining Industri. SGER stated this transaction has the potential to generate revenue amounting to 3 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: INKP Plans to Issue Bonds up to Rp3.5 Trillion and Sukuk up to Rp2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP) plans to issue bonds up to 3.5 trillion rupiah and sukuk up to 2 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for debt repayment and working capital. The bonds and sukuk each consist of 3 series (tenor 370 days, 3 years, and 5 years) with interest rates/profit sharing rates of 7.25%, 10.25%, and 10.75% respectively. The bonds and sukuk have received an idA+ and idA+(sy) rating from Pefindo, respectively. The public offering period is estimated to take place on November 26-28, 2024.

tickerNews.title: TBIG Plans to Issue Bonds Worth Rp2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) plans to issue bonds worth 2 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for bond repayment and a portion of bank principal debt. The bonds consist of Series A worth approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah (6.45% interest and 370-day tenor) and Series B worth approximately 757 billion rupiah (6.75% interest and 3-year tenor). The bonds have received an AA+(idn) rating from Fitch Ratings. The public offering period is estimated to take place on November 25-27, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) Acquires and Operates 4 Shipping Vessels Through Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) through its subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, announced that it has acquired and operated 4 oil or chemical carriers and a liquefied natural gas carrier. The total transaction value has not been announced. These vessels are the first fleet owned by PT Chandra Daya Investasi and will be operated by its subsidiaries, namely PT Chandra Shipping International and PT Marina Indah Maritim.

tickerNews.title: MBMA President Director Devin Antonio Ridwan Submits Resignation Letter
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) announced that the company's president director, Devin Antonio Ridwan, submitted a letter of resignation application on November 11, 2024. This application will be discussed in an EGM for which the date has not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Shareholders Approve Rauf Purnama as President Commissioner, Replacing F. X. Sutijastoto
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Aneka Tambang (ANTM) on Wednesday (13/11) approved the appointment of Rauf Purnama as the company's president commissioner and independent commissioner, replacing F. X. Sutijastoto. Kontan reported that Rauf Purnama was previously recorded as an expert council member in the National Campaign Team of Prabowo Subianto-Gibran Rakabuming Raka in the 2024 presidential election. Rauf also previously served as president director at PT Petrokimia Gresik (1995-2001) and expert staff to the Minister of Industry (2004-2009).

tickerNews.title: JTPE to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp7 per Share
tickerNews.content: Jasuindo Tiga Perkasa (JTPE) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 48 billion rupiah or 7 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 21, 2024, with payment on December 11, 2024. Referring to the JTPE share price at the Wednesday (13/11) closing at 242 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: INV Management Pte. Ltd. Sells 8 Million CYBR Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of ITSEC Asia (CYBR), INV Management Pte. Ltd., sold 8 million CYBR shares at an average price of 307 rupiah per share on November 8, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of INV Management Pte. Ltd. in CYBR decreased from 47.7% to 47.6%.

tickerNews.title: IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd. Sells 180,000 FORU Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Fortune Indonesia (FORU), IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd., sold 180,000 FORU shares at an average price of 5,191 rupiah per share on November 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached 934 million rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd. in FORU decreased from 77.37% to 77.33%.
